[File: crates/aptos-transaction-filters/src/block_transaction_filter.rs] [Function: BlockMatcher::matches()] [Epoch boundary attacks] Can attackers exploit epoch transitions by submitting transactions at exact epoch boundaries to bypass GreaterThan/LessThan filters? (Medium)

[File: crates/aptos-transaction-filters/src/transaction_filter.rs] [Struct: TransactionFilter] [Deserialization validation] Does deserialization of TransactionFilter validate that transaction_rules don't contain malicious or contradictory rules? (High)

[File: crates/aptos-transaction-filters/src/transaction_filter.rs] [Enum: TransactionRule] [Serialized rule injection] Can an attacker craft malicious serialized rules that bypass validation during deserialization? (High)

[File: crates/aptos-transaction-filters/src/transaction_filter.rs] [Enum: TransactionMatcher] [Variant exhaustion] Does the pattern matching explicitly handle all current and future TransactionMatcher variants to prevent bypass via new enum variants? (Medium)

[File: crates/aptos-transaction-filters/src/batch_transaction_filter.rs] [Struct: BatchTransactionFilter] [Batch rule deserialization attack] Can malicious serialized batch filters be crafted to inject permissive rules during config updates? (High)

[File: crates/aptos-transaction-filters/src/batch_transaction_filter.rs] [Enum: BatchMatcher] [Enum variant addition vulnerability] Are all BatchMatcher variants explicitly handled in matching logic to prevent future bypass vulnerabilities? (Low)

[File: crates/aptos-transaction-filters/src/block_transaction_filter.rs] [Struct: BlockTransactionFilter] [Block filter configuration attack] Can attackers manipulate serialized block filter configs to create permissive filtering during governance upgrades? (High)

[File: crates/aptos-transaction-filters/src/transaction_filter.rs] [Function: filter_transactions()] [Transaction batch DoS] Can an attacker submit thousands of transactions to cause excessive filtering iterations and CPU exhaustion? (Medium)

[File: crates/aptos-transaction-filters/src/transaction_filter.rs] [Function: TransactionRule::matches()] [Matcher count DoS] Can rules with hundreds of matchers cause exponential evaluation time and validator slowdown? (Low)

[File: crates/aptos-transaction-filters/src/batch_transaction_filter.rs] [Function: filter_batch_transactions()] [Batch size DoS] Can malicious batches with thousands of transactions overwhelm the filtering pipeline? (Medium)

[File: crates/aptos-transaction-filters/src/block_transaction_filter.rs] [Function: filter_block_transactions()] [Block transaction count explosion] Can blocks with excessive transaction counts cause memory exhaustion during filter processing? (Medium)

[File: crates/aptos-transaction-filters/src/transaction_filter.rs] [Function: matches_transaction_authenticator_address()] [MultiKey DoS] Can MultiKey authenticators with thousands of public keys cause CPU exhaustion during address matching? (Low)

[File: crates/aptos-transaction-filters/src/transaction_filter.rs] [Function: matches_transaction_authenticator_public_key()] [FeePayer signer enumeration DoS] Can FeePayer transactions with excessive secondary_signers cause filtering performance degradation? (Low)

[File: crates/aptos-transaction-filters/src/transaction_filter.rs] [Struct: TransactionFilter] [Concurrent filter modification] Can concurrent calls to add_multiple_matchers_filter() during transaction processing cause data races or filter inconsistency? (Medium)

[File: crates/aptos-transaction-filters/src/batch_transaction_filter.rs] [Struct: BatchTransactionFilter] [Batch processing race condition] Can concurrent batch filtering operations lead to inconsistent allow/deny decisions for identical transactions? (Medium)

[File: crates/aptos-transaction-filters/src/block_transaction_filter.rs] [Struct: BlockTransactionFilter] [Block filter update race] Can filter rule updates during block execution cause some transactions to be evaluated with stale rules? (Medium)

[File: crates/aptos-transaction-filters/src/transaction_filter.rs] [Function: allows_transaction()] [TOCTOU vulnerability] Can the transaction state change between filter evaluation and actual execution, bypassing filtering? (High)

[File: crates/aptos-transaction-filters/src/transaction_filter.rs] [Function: matches_entry_function()] [TransactionPayload variant incompleteness] Are all TransactionPayload variants (including future additions) explicitly handled to prevent filter bypass? (Medium)

[File: crates/aptos-transaction-filters/src/transaction_filter.rs] [Function: matches_account_authenticator_address()] [AccountAuthenticator future variants] Does the explicit matching ensure compiler errors if new authenticator types are added without filter updates? (Low)

[File: crates/aptos-transaction-filters/src/transaction_filter.rs] [Function: matches_any_public_key_address()] [AnyPublicKey future key types] Are future public key types guaranteed to be explicitly handled or will they bypass filtering? (Medium)

[File: crates/aptos-transaction-filters/src/transaction_filter.rs] [Function: matches_transaction_authenticator_address()] [TransactionAuthenticator completeness] Does explicit variant matching prevent filter bypass when new authenticator types are added? (Low)

[File: crates/aptos-transaction-filters/src/transaction_filter.rs] [Module: transaction_filter] [Mempool integration bypass] Can malicious transactions bypass filters by exploiting the integration between transaction filters and the mempool admission control? (Critical)

[File: crates/aptos-transaction-filters/src/transaction_filter.rs] [Module: transaction_filter] [Consensus integration vulnerability] Can consensus nodes apply filters inconsistently, leading to chain forks where different validators accept different transaction sets? (Critical)

[File: crates/aptos-transaction-filters/src/batch_transaction_filter.rs] [Module: batch_transaction_filter] [Quorum store bypass] Can batch filters be bypassed by exploiting the integration with the quorum store batch verification system? (High)

[File: crates/aptos-transaction-filters/src/block_transaction_filter.rs] [Module: block_transaction_filter] [Block production integration] Can block proposers selectively apply block filters to include their own malicious transactions while filtering others? (Critical)
